data.title: 2015 Draft - 5th pick: Miroslav Svoboda
data.meta_site_name: HFBoards - NHL Message Board and Forum for National Hockey League
data.text:
The Oilers have until June 1st to sign him or they lose his signing rights.... is he a prospect worth holding onto?

From the looks of his stats he seem to be doing pretty well...

http://www.eliteprospects.com/player.php?player=101860

Do the Oilers have enough G now with Brossoit/Wells/Ellis/Starrett (and maybe Laurikainen)?

The Oilers have until June 1st to sign him or they lose his signing rights.... is he a prospect worth holding onto?

From the looks of his stats he seem to be doing pretty well...

http://www.eliteprospects.com/player.php?player=101860

Do the Oilers have enough G now with Brossoit/Wells/Ellis/Starrett (and maybe Laurikainen)?

I think hes a propect worth keeping. With LB backing up on the big club ...and Ellis/Starett likely in Bakersfield. Wells possibly back in the OHL as an over ager...I wonder if the Oilers try and convince him to come over and push for an AHL job against Starett...either way 1 of the 2 would end up the starter in Wichita (ECHL)

Looks like he just signed a contract with HC Plzen a month ago that'll get him to be a starter in the Czech pro league finally(he's been in the second tier Czech league the last couple years). I doubt he'll come over to play ECHL but it might be worth it to sign him to an ELC and then loan him back to that squad for the year and see how he does.

I think it's always worthwhile to have a goalie developing overseas.

By the looks of HC Plzen's roster, he has a good chance to start in the top Czech league next season.

It can't hurt to let him play a year or two over there and then figure out if he's worth bringing over, IMO.
